meeting_annotations.speaker: Jarad Mason
meeting_annotations.transcript: I can maybe comment a little bit. Not so much necessarily on direct process integration, but more something that has to be considered I guess as part of that that doesn't receive that much attention on materials characterization side, which is just thermal conductivity and like managing heat during absorption and desorption processes. Um particularly for solid absorbents, but I assume for liquid spirits as well. Um and I think particularly when you're thinking about thermal swing type processes for absorbing and desorbing CO2, you're kind of there's intrinsic kind of thermodynamic inefficiencies that are kind of built into what you're doing. Um so like absorbing CO2 is always going to be exothermic. Um and that's going to heat up your material and when your material gets hot, it's going to absorb less CO2 in almost every case.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Jarad Mason
meeting_annotations.transcript: And so you need to have systems in place to manage those temperature increases um during absorption processes.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Jarad Mason
meeting_annotations.transcript: Um but then you want to put heat into your material to desorb the CO2. So there's kind of an inefficiency there because you're trying to dissipate a bunch of heat just to put a bunch of heat back in and so there's opportunities to think about how to to deal with that.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Jarad Mason
meeting_annotations.transcript: Um and the same is true during desorption. Um desorption is endothermic, so your material gets colder and holds onto CO2 if you're doing a pure thermal swing. Um and so I think thinking about that is important and then also just there's usually not very much that's understood about thermal conductivity of different types of absorbents and it's a property that's not often measured.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Jarad Mason
meeting_annotations.transcript: Um but is really important um in terms of being able to have uh easier and easier ability to control um heat transport uh and manage temperature fluctuations in any kind of CO2 capture system.
